com.github.kennedyoliveira.pastebin4j

Class Paste

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.kennedyoliveira.pastebin4j.api.BasePaste
      • com.github.kennedyoliveira.pastebin4j.Paste
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GuestPaste

    public class Paste
extends BasePaste

    Represents a paste.

    Can be used to create pastes and fetch remote content, check paste(AccountCredentials), paste(PasteBin) and getContent()

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Paste builder static inner class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Paste

        public Paste()

        Creates an empty paste.

        We recomend using the builder methods, see newBuilder()

      • Paste

        public Paste(java.lang.String key)

        Creates a paste with an unique key, use this constructor when you wanna get a pastes content or delete a paste.

        Parameters:
        key - Paste unique key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key is null

      • Paste

        public Paste(java.lang.String title,
             java.lang.String content,
             PasteHighLight highLight,
             PasteExpiration expiration,
             PasteVisibility visibility)

        Creates a completly paste ready to be uploaded

        Parameters:
        title - The title of the paste, can be null
        content - The content of the paste, can't be null
        highLight - The highlightm default is text, can be null
        expiration - The expiration, can be null
        visibility - The visibility, can be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the content is null.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.lang.String key)

        Sets a new unique key.

        Beware, this information is fetched by the API, doens't set it manually unless you know what you are doing.

        Parameters:
        key - the new key.

      • fetchContent

        public java.lang.String fetchContent()

        Fetch the online contents of a paste. If the paste visibility is PasteVisibility.PRIVATE it 'll throw an exception, so to fetch private pastes use PasteBin.getPasteContent(Paste).

        Important Note: This method will replace the content with the fetched content!

        Returns:
        the fetched content

      • paste

        public java.lang.String paste(AccountCredentials accountCredentials)

        Shortcut method to create a paste using a AccountCredentials

        Parameters:
        accountCredentials - The credentials to log in the api and create the paste.
        Returns:
        A link to the paste.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the accountCredentials is null or content is null.

      • paste

        public java.lang.String paste(PasteBin pasteBin)

        Uses an already created PasteBin to post.

        It's the same as doing PasteBin.createPaste(Paste) and passing the this paste.

        Parameters:
        pasteBin - the PasteBin to be used to create the paste.
        Returns:
        A link to the paste.

      • getExpirationDate

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getExpirationDate()

        Gets the date that this paste will expire, but doesn't consider the current locale

        For a date considering the current locale, check the getLocalExpirationDate()

        Returns:
        The date that this paste will expire.

      • getLocalExpirationDate

        public java.time.ZonedDateTime getLocalExpirationDate()

      • getLocalPasteDate

        public java.time.ZonedDateTime getLocalPasteDate()

      • getPasteDate

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getPasteDate()

        Gets the creation date time of this paste, but doens't consider the current locale

        For a date considering the current locale, check the getLocalPasteDate() method.

        Returns:
        Creation date time of this paste.
